title: The Strongest Man in the World
subject: The Secret of the Strongest Man Who Ever Lived
author: Gary Halbert
body:
Dear Friend,

In 1961, Paul Anderson was certified by the Guinness Book of World Records as "The Strongest Man Who Ever Lived."

He could:

• Lift 6,270 pounds off the ground (that's over 3 tons)
• Squat 1,200 pounds for 2 reps
• Bench press 600 pounds
• Overhead press 400 pounds

No human being before or since has matched his strength.

But here's what's interesting:

Paul Anderson didn't train like other strongmen.

He didn't spend 6 hours a day in the gym.

He didn't do endless sets of exercises.

He didn't follow any of the "traditional" training methods.

Instead...

He trained for only 45 minutes a day.

3 days a week.

Doing just 3-5 exercises per workout.

And he got stronger than anyone in human history.

How?

He discovered something that modern science has now proven:

More training does NOT equal more strength.

In fact, it's the opposite.

Your muscles don't grow during your workout.

They grow during REST.

The workout just provides the stimulus.

The growth happens when you're recovering.

So if you're working out 6 days a week, doing 20 sets per muscle group, training for 2-3 hours at a time...

You're actually PREVENTING your muscles from growing.

You're breaking them down faster than they can recover.

This is why so many guys train for years and barely get any bigger or stronger.

They're overtraining.

Now, I'm not a strongman like Paul Anderson.

But I've been studying strength training for over 20 years.

And I've developed a program based on Paul Anderson's principles:

Short workouts.

Minimal exercises.

Maximum rest.

And maximum results.

It's called "The 45-Minute Strength Solution."

And here's exactly what you get:

• The complete 12-week training program - exactly which exercises to do, how many sets, how many reps, which days to train

• The "overtraining test" - a simple way to know if you're training too much (most guys are)

• The "perfect workout length" formula - why 45 minutes is the magic number for muscle growth

• The "recovery maximizer" protocol - how to ensure your muscles have everything they need to grow as fast as possible

• Exercise substitutions - so you can train at home, at a gym, or anywhere in between

• The "plateau buster" technique - what to do when you stop making gains (this alone is worth the price)

• Nutrition guidelines - simple, no-BS advice on eating for strength (not complicated, just effective)

Now, here's the deal:

This program works.

I've tested it on myself and dozens of other guys.

Every single one got stronger.

Most added 50-100 pounds to their bench press in 12 weeks.

Many added 30-50 pounds of muscle.

Some completely transformed their physiques.

But I can't guarantee you'll get those exact results.

What I CAN guarantee is this:

Follow this program exactly as written for 12 weeks.

If you're not significantly stronger and more muscular at the end...

I'll refund every penny you paid.

And you can keep the program.

That's how confident I am this works.

The investment?

Just $47.

Less than a single session with a personal trainer.

Less than a month of gym membership at most places.

For a complete 12-week program that will make you stronger than you've ever been.

To order, simply fill out the form below and mail it with your payment.

Or call the number at the bottom of this page to order by phone.

You'll receive the complete program within 7 business days.

And 12 weeks from now, you'll be stronger than you ever thought possible.

Guaranteed.

Your friend in strength,

Gary C. Halbert

P.S. Paul Anderson proved that more training isn't the answer. This program shows you exactly how to train LESS and get STRONGER. But you have to actually follow it. Order now and start your transformation today.
